content: Singaporean businesswoman and investor **Chew Gek Khim** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 周玉琴; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Zhōu Yùqín*) is a Singaporean businesswoman and investor who is the chairperson of companies including the [Straits Trading Company](/wiki/Straits_Trading_Company). She is the granddaughter of former [OCBC Bank](/wiki/OCBC_Bank) chairman [Tan Chin Tuan](/wiki/Tan_Chin_Tuan). According to *[Forbes](/wiki/Forbes)*, she is part of one of the richest families in Singapore with a net worth of $1.4 billion. Chew was voted Singapore's Businessperson of the Year in 2014 and 2015. ## Biography Chew was born in Singapore in 1961 and grew up alongside her grandfather [Tan Chin Tuan](/wiki/Tan_Chin_Tuan). She studied at the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) and graduated with a bachelor's degree in law before joining law firm [Drew & Napier](/wiki/Drew_%26_Napier), where she specialized in [corporate law](/wiki/Corporate_law). After practicing for three years, she left to join her family's investment group, Tecity. Chew eventually became the executive chairman of Tecity and oversaw the company's eventual takeover of [Straits Trading](/wiki/Straits_Trading_Company) in 2008. After purchasing Straits Trading, Chew went about making changes to its mining operations by focusing on the production of [tin](/wiki/Tin) and by diversifying its interests to expand into [real estate](/wiki/Real_estate) and [hospitality](/wiki/Hospitality). This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Chew Gek Khim
